channel.title: Saving 200+ images
channel.description:
Well, there is this site that has a lot of images I am interested in (no, not porn :P). It's a book but it has more then 200 pages, and I want them all on my computer. The problem is that they are all on a seperate page. Is there a way to save them all at once? Because that would save me a lot of work. If this is of any help, the url ends in this format /image/page1, /image/page2 etc...
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Saving 200+ images
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Lol. A little general, but there is a firefox addon for this.

DownThemAll or flashgot is what he might be referring to. As long as you can get all the links you want are one one page, it should get them all.

Here are a few more you can look at, and see which one looks the best for your need.
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/2503
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/4481 - lol facebook

Read full topic

item.title: Saving 200+ images
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

or use that firefox addon

item.title: Saving 200+ images
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

he could do that, or he could just go to .com/bookhere/image/page1 in an ftp, and download the entire directory.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving 200+ images
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Get a scar script that right clicks on one, clicks save as, types an incremental number, goes to the next page, and repeats the process

Read full topic
